bubble.script.name: qisqa_sayohat
bubble.screenreaderIntro: Please note, all 9 steps of the EarSketch tour are listed below in an unordered list. Select the "$t(bubble:buttons.close)" button when you are ready to use EarSketch.
bubble.screenreaderCloseTour: Please note: In order to close the tour at any point, select the "$t(bubble:buttons.close)" button.

body.start:
Are you ready to start coding and composing? If you are a first time user, click Start below for a quick tour of the EarSketch interface. If you are an experienced user, click Skip to start coding.

EarSketch is free to use under the terms of our license agreement.

The default programming language for this tour is Python. Click below to change to JavaScript.
body.codeEditor: Kod muharriri musiqa bastalash uchun sizning ish joyingizdir. Bu raqamlangan satrlarga ega matn muharriri.
body.runCode: Run the code to generate your music. Click the RUN button and view your arrangement in the Digital Audio Workstation located above the code editor.
body.previewMusic: The Digital Audio Workstation (DAW) is a timeline visualization of your music, showing time in both seconds and measures. Below the timeline sounds are arranged on one or more tracks.
body.playMusic: The buttons at the top right of the DAW will allow you to listen to your music. You can play your song by clicking the green triangle .
body.exploreCode: The browsers are here on the left. Click the toggle switch at the top to hide or reveal them. There are several types of browsers, and we will explore each in the next steps.
body.addSounds: The first browser is SOUNDS. Scroll, search, and filter through the list to discover 4,000+ sounds to use in your music, composed by popular recording artists.
body.saveCode: Your code is automatically saved to SCRIPTS. From the script menu you can download your music as an audio file.
body.readCurriculum: On the right side is the curriculum panel. Use the toggle switch to display the curriculum, and the click the navigation bar to view the table of contents.
body.end: Congratulations on completing the tour! You're now ready to start making music. Click to create a new script and start coding.

download.mp3: Qo'shig'ingizni MP3 fayli sifatida saqlang (kamroq disk maydoni egallaydi, audio sifati pastroq bo'ladi).
download.multitrack: Qo'shig'ingizning har bir trekni alohida WAV fayli sifatida saqlang (GarageBand, Logic, Pro Tools, Reaper, FruityLoops, Cubase, Audition yoki Live kabi raqamli audio ish stantsiyasi dasturiga import qilish uchun).

menuDescriptions.viewOnly: Boshqalar mening skriptimni ko'rishini xohlayman. (Ular tahrir qila olmaydi.)
menuDescriptions.collaboration: Boshqalar mening skriptimni tahrir qila olishini xohlayman.
menuDescriptions.embedded: Men qo'shig'imni veb-saytga joylashtirish imkoniga ega bo'lmoqchiman.

analyze.description: This function analyzes a sound for the specified feature.

sound.description: Sound to analyze. Typically this is a constant from the sound browser.

feature.description: Tahlil xususiyati konstantasi. Tahlil funktsiyalari hozirda ikkita xususiyatni rag'batlantiradi: RMS_AMPLITUDE tovushning balandlik darajasini tahlil qiladi va SPECTRAL_CENTROID tovushning yorqinlik darajasini tahlil qiladi.

returns.description: Maxsus xususiyat uchun hisoblash natijasi (doim 0 dan 1 gacha).

example.python:
# Spectral centroid of a sound
centroid = analyze(HOUSE_BREAKBEAT_001, SPECTRAL_CENTROID)
example.javascript:
// Spectral centroid of a sound
var centroid = analyze(HOUSE_BREAKBEAT_001, SPECTRAL_CENTROID);

analyzeForTime.description: This function analyzes a sound for the specified feature, for the specified start and end times.

sound.description: Sound to analyze. Typically this is a constant from the sound browser.

feature.description: Analysis feature constant. The analysis functions currently support two features: RMS_AMPLITUDE analyzes how loud the sound is and SPECTRAL_CENTROID analyzes how bright the sound is.

sliceStart.description: Tahlilni boshlash uchun tovush ichidagi joylashuvni boshlang

sliceEnd.description: Tahlilni yakunlash uchun ovoz ichidagi joylashuvni tugating

returns.description: Result of the calculation for the specified feature (always between 0 and 1 inclusive).

example.python:
# Spectral centroid for part of a sound
sound = HOUSE_BREAKBEAT_001
centroid = analyzeForTime(sound, SPECTRAL_CENTROID, 1.25, 1.5)

analyzeTrack.description: Bu funktsiya belgilangan xususiyat uchun butun trekni tahlil qiladi.

feature.description: Analysis feature constant. The analysis functions currently support two features: RMS_AMPLITUDE analyzes how loud the sound is and SPECTRAL_CENTROID analyzes how bright the sound is.

returns.description: Result of the calculation for the specified feature (always between 0 and 1 inclusive).

example.python:
# Spectral centroid of a track
fitMedia(HOUSE_BREAKBEAT_001, 1, 1, 3)
centroid = analyzeTrack(1, SPECTRAL_CENTROID)

analyzeTrackForTime.description: Bu funktsiya boshlanish va tugash vaqti o'rtasidagi belgilangan trekni tahlil qiladi.

feature.description: Analysis feature constant. The analysis functions currently support two features: RMS_AMPLITUDE analyzes how loud the sound is and SPECTRAL_CENTROID analyzes how bright the sound is.

start.description: Tahlilni boshlash uchun trek ichida joylashuvni boshlang

end.description: Tahlilni yakunlash uchun trek ichidagi joylashuvni yakunlang

returns.description: Result of the calculation for the specified feature (always between 0 and 1 inclusive).

example.python:
# Spectral centroid for part of a track
fitMedia(HOUSE_BREAKBEAT_001, 1, 1, 3)
centroid = analyzeTrackForTime(1, SPECTRAL_CENTROID, 1.25, 1.5)

createAudioSlice.description: Returns a sound constant that represents a slice of another sound.

sound.description: The sound from which to create a slice. This is a constant from the sound browser.

returns.description: A new sound constant representing a slice of audio.

example.python:
# Extract part of a sound
sound = HOUSE_BREAKBEAT_001
slice = createAudioSlice(sound, 1.5, 2.5)
fitMedia(slice, 1, 1, 3)

createAudioStretch.description: Returns a sound constant that represents a sound timestretched from its original tempo.

sound.description: The sound from which to create the timestretched sound. This is a constant from the sound browser.

stretchFactor.description: How much to timestretch the sound. Here "2" means "twice as long".

returns.description: A new sound constant representing the timestretched audio.

example.python:
# Stretch the sound to be twice as long
sound = RD_ROCK_POPRHYTHM_MAINDRUMS_4
stretched = createAudioStretch(sound, 2)
fitMedia(stretched, 1, 1, 9)

dur.description: Returns the duration of a sound in measures.

sound.description: The sound whose duration to return. Typically, this is a constant from the sound browser.

example.python: duration = dur(HOUSE_BREAKBEAT_001)
example.javascript: var duration = dur(HOUSE_BREAKBEAT_001);

finish.description: Ushbu funktsiya ixtiyoriy ravishda skript oxirida chaqirilishi mumkin (EarSketchning oldingi versiyalarida bu majburiy bo'lgan).

example.python:
# Rest of script above this line...
finish()
example.javascript:
// Rest of script above this line...
finish();

fitMedia.description: Adds a sound to a specified track at specified start and end times. The sound will be repeated or cut short as needed to fill the specified amount of time.

sound.description: Sound to place on track. Typically this is a constant from the sound browser

track.description: Track number to insert sound onto

start.description: Location within the track where the sound will begin (e.g. 1 will start at the beginning of measure 1).

end.description: Location within the track where the sound will end (e.g. 5 will stop the sound at the beginning of measure 5).

example.python:
# Add a sound to a track, repeating or trimming as necessary
# Here it repeats from measure 2 to the start of measure 9
fitMedia(HIPHOP_FUNKBEAT_001, 1, 2, 9)

importImage.description: Bu funktsiya internetdan tasvirni oladi va uni kulrang shkala qiymatlarining ikki oÊ»lchamli massiv/ro'yxatiga yoki maxsus belgilangan qatorlar va ustunlar soniga ega masshtabli RGB rang qiymatlarining uch oÊ»lchamli ro'yxatiga aylantiradi.

nrows.description: Qaytariladigan piksel ma'lumotlari qatorlari soni (tasvir shu qatorlar soniga mos keladigan tarzda o'lchanadi)

ncols.description: Qaytariladigan piksel ma'lumotlarining ustunlar soni (Tasvir ushbu ustunlar soniga mos keladigan tarzda o'lchanadi)

includeRGB.description: Agar yolg'on bo'lsa, ikki o'lchamli kulrang shkala ro'yxatini qaytaradi. Agar rost boÊ»lsa, uch oÊ»lchamli RGB rangli piksellar roÊ»yxatini qaytaradi. Uchinchi oÊ»lcham mos ravishda R, G va B hisoblanadi.

returns.description: Piksellarni ifodalovchi ko'p o'lchamli butun sonlar ro'yxati (0-255).

example.python:
# Turn an image into a 10x10 grayscale list
url = "https://cdn.pixabay.com/photo/2012/04/05/01/17/ear-25595_640.png"
pixelData = importImage(url, 10, 10, False)

importFile.description: Bu funktsiya internetdan faylni oladi va uning tarkibini satr sifatida qaytaradi.

example.python:
# Load a file via URL
fileData = importFile("https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/iso_8859-1.txt")
example.javascript:
// Load a file via URL
var fileData = importFile("https://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/iso_8859-1.txt");

init.description: Ushbu funktsiya ixtiyoriy ravishda skript boshida chaqirilishi mumkin (EarSketch-ning avvalgi versiyalarida bu majburiy bo'gan).

example.python:
init()
# Rest of script below this line...
example.javascript:
init();
// Rest of script below this line...

insertMedia.description: Belgilangan boshlanish vaqtida butun media faylni belgilangan trekka kiritadi.

sound.description: Sound to insert on track. Typically this is a constant from the sound browser

track.description: Track number to insert sound onto

start.description: The location within the track at which to start playback of the sound. (The sound will play through one time, so the end time depends on the length of the sound.)

example.python:
# Add a sound on track 1, measure 2, beat 3
insertMedia(HOUSE_BREAKBEAT_003, 1, 2.5)
example.javascript:
// Add a sound on track 1, measure 2, beat 3
insertMedia(HOUSE_BREAKBEAT_003, 1, 2.5);

insertMediaSection.description: Inserts a part of a sound on a specified track at a specified location.

sound.description: Sound to insert on track. Typically this is a constant from the sound browser

track.description: Track number to insert sound onto

start.description: The location within the track at which to start playback of the sound file (e.g. 1 will start at the beginning of measure 1)

sliceStart.description: Start location within the sound to include (e.g. 1.0 is the beginning of the sound and 2.0 is measure 2 of the sound)

sliceEnd.description: End location within the sound to include (e.g. 2.0 is measure 2 of the sound)

example.python:
# Add part of a sound to a track
sound = RD_UK_HOUSE_WURLITZER_3
insertMediaSection(sound, 1, 1.5, 2.5, 3.0)

makeBeat1.description: Creates a rhythmic pattern through specifying a string of characters. This string of characters can be of ANY length. We recommend choosing string lengths in multiples of 16 (e.g. 16, 32, 64, etc.), because this creates pattern lengths that are aligned with measures (each measure is 16 characters long).

sound.description: A single sound or a list/array of sounds. Typically this is a constant from the sound browser

start.description: Location within the track to start pattern (e.g. 1 will start at the beginning of measure 1)

beat.description: A string indicating the rhythmic pattern to play. "0" plays the sound for a sixteenth note. "+" ties (i.e. continues or sustains) the sound for an additional sixteenth note. "-" rests (i.e. creates silence) for a sixteenth note. If the first argument to makeBeat is a list/array of sounds, "0" through "9" and "A" through "F" will play the sound at that list/array index for a sixteenth note.

example.python:
# Remix sounds into a new beat
s = HIPHOP_FUNKBEAT_001
makeBeat(s, 1, 1, "0++-0---0---0---")
s = [Y01_HI_HATS_1, Y01_OPEN_HI_HATS_1]
makeBeat(s, 2, 1, "--10--10--100010")

makeBeat2.description: Creates a rhythmic pattern through specifying a string of characters. This string of characters can be of ANY length. We recommend choosing string lengths in multiples of 16 (e.g. 16, 32, 64, etc.), because this creates pattern lengths that are aligned with measures (each measure is 16 characters long).

sound.description: A single sound or a list/array of sounds. Typically this is a constant from the sound browser

start.description: Location within the track to start pattern (e.g. 1 will start at the beginning of measure 1)

beat.description: A string indicating the rhythmic pattern to play. "0" plays the sound for a sixteenth note. "+" ties (i.e. continues or sustains) the sound for an additional sixteenth note. "-" rests (i.e. creates silence) for a sixteenth note. If the first argument to makeBeat is a list/array of sounds, "0" through "9" and "A" through "F" will play the sound at that list/array index for a sixteenth note.

stepsPerMeasure.description: A number that specifies the length of time for a single character in your beat string. The default value of 16 results in one sixteenth note.

example.python:
# Bongo triplets
makeBeat(IRCA_OS_BONGO_HIGH_OPEN, 1, 1, "000", 3)
makeBeat(IRCA_OS_BONGO_LOW_OPEN, 2, 1, "0000", 4)

makeBeatSlice1.description: Creates a rhythmic pattern through specifying a string of characters indicating the start position within a sound. Unlike makeBeat, which always plays sounds from the beginning, makeBeatSlice lets you create rhythms that combine many different slices of sound from the same sound.

sound.description: A single sound. Typically this is a constant from the sound browser

start.description: Location within the track to start pattern (e.g. 1 will start at the beginning of measure 1)

beat.description: A string indicating the rhythmic pattern to play. "0" through "9" and "A" through "F" plays the sound at the location specified at the corresponding index of the beatNumber list/array for a sixteenth note. "+" ties (i.e. continues or sustains) the sound for an additional sixteenth note. "-" rests (i.e. creates silence) for a sixteenth note.

sliceStarts.description: A list/array of starting locations within the sound. For example, [1.0, 2.5] creates two time locations at measure 1 and measure 2.5 of the sound that can be referenced in the beat string by "0" and "1" respectively.

example.python:
# Slice and rearrange by sixteenth notes
s = RD_RNB_MOOGLEAD_10
slices = [1.0, 1.375, 1.25, 1.5, 2.0, 2.25]
makeBeatSlice(s, 1, 1, "4--04-0-30-10+30", slices)

makeBeatSlice2.description: Creates a rhythmic pattern through specifying a string of characters indicating the start position within a sound. Unlike makeBeat, which always plays sounds from the beginning, makeBeatSlice lets you create rhythms that combine many different slices of sound from the same sound.

sound.description: A single sound. Typically this is a constant from the sound browser

start.description: Location within the track to start pattern (e.g. 1 will start at the beginning of measure 1)

beat.description: A string indicating the rhythmic pattern to play. "0" through "9" and "A" through "F" plays the sound at the location specified at the corresponding index of the beatNumber list/array for a sixteenth note. "+" ties (i.e. continues or sustains) the sound for an additional sixteenth note. "-" rests (i.e. creates silence) for a sixteenth note.

sliceStarts.description: A list/array of starting locations within the sound. For example, [1.0, 2.5] creates two time locations at measure 1 and measure 2.5 of the sound that can be referenced in the beat string by "0" and "1" respectively.

stepsPerMeasure.description: A number that specifies the length of time for a single character in your beat string. The default value of 16 results in one sixteenth note.

example.python:
# Slice and rearrange by eighth notes
sound = HIPHOP_TRAPHOP_BEAT_002
eighths = [1.0, 1.125, 1.25, 1.375, 1.5, 1.625, 1.75, 1.875]
beat = "01261264"
makeBeatSlice(sound, 1, 1, beat, eighths, 8)

print(1 + 2)
print("hello!")

println.description: Displays the input in the console.

example.javascript:
println(1 + 2);
println("hello!");

readInput.description: Kiritishni foydalanuvchiga taklif qilish uchun ushbu funktsiyadan foydalaning.

example.python:
# User-provided beat string
beat = readInput("Enter a beat, like 0-0-0")
makeBeat(OS_CLAP01, 1, 1, beat)

replaceListElement.description: RoÊ»yxat/massiv elementining barcha holatlarini yangi element bilan almashtirish.

withElement.description: ElementToReplace-ning barcha holatlarini almashtiradigan yangi element.

example.python:
# Replace OS_SNARE01 wth OS_CLAP01
sounds = [OS_KICK01, OS_SNARE01, OS_CLOSEDHAT01]
replaced = replaceListElement(sounds, OS_SNARE01, OS_CLAP01)

replaceString.description: Bu funktsiya asl satrdagi belgining barcha nusxalarini yangi belgi bilan almashtiradi.

withCharacter.description: CharacterToReplace ning barcha holatlarini almashtiradigan yangi belgi

returns.description: Yangi satr tegishli belgi(lar) bilan almashtirildi

example.python:
# Change all '0's to '1's
beat1 = "0---0---0---0---"
beat2 = replaceString(beat1, "0", "1")

returns.description: Teskari tartibda elementlar bilan yangi ro'yxat/massiv

example.python:
# Reverse a list of sounds
sounds = [OS_CLAP04, OS_COWBELL03, OS_LOWTOM02]
reversed = reverseList(sounds)

returns.description: Belgilari teskari tartibda joylashgan yangi satr

example.python:
# Reverse a beat string
beat = "0+++0---0----000"
reversed = reverseString(beat)

rhythmEffects.description: Belgilar satrini belgilash orqali ritmik effektli zarf yaratadi.

track.description: Andozani oÊ»rnatish uchun trek (yoki barcha treklarga qoÊ»llash uchun MIX_TRACK).

effect.description: Options: BANDPASS, CHORUS, COMPRESSOR, DELAY, DISTORTION, EQ3BAND, FILTER, FLANGER, PAN, PHASER, PITCHSHIFT, REVERB, RINGMOD, TREMOLO, VOLUME, or WAH.

parameter.description: EffektType-ning qaysi parametri uchun zarf yaratilishini ko'rsatuvchi konstanta. (effekt parametrlarining to'liq ro'yxati uchun o'quv dasturining yon paneliga qarang: Har Bir Effektning Batafsil Tavsifi.)

start.description: Location within the track to start pattern (e.g. 1 will start at the beginning of measure 1)

beat.description: A string indicating the effect pattern to create. Each character represents one "step" (default is a sixteenth note). Numbers 0 to 9 and then A to F indicate entries from the list/array ("0" represents the first value, "1" represents the second, "A" represents the eleventh, "B" represents the twelfth, etc). "+" ties (sustains/continues) the previous value. "-" ramps (creates a gradual change) from the previous to the next value.

stepsPerMeasure.description: A number that specifies the length of time of a single character in your beatString. The default value of 16 results in one sixteenth note.

example.python:
# Change the pitchshift over time
fitMedia(DUBSTEP_BASS_WOBBLE_015, 1, 1, 3)
rhythmEffects(1, PITCHSHIFT, PITCHSHIFT_SHIFT, [0, -12], 1, "0---1++0", 4)

folderSubstring.description: Standart jildlarning qay biridan tasodifiy tovushni tanlash kerakligini ko'rsatuvchi quyi-satr. Odatda, bu ovoz brauzeridan jild nomining bir qismi (tovush konstantasi emas).

example.python:
# Choose a random sound from a folder
sound = selectRandomFile(ALT_POP_GUITAR)
fitMedia(sound, 1, 1, 5)

setEffect1.description: Ushbu funktsiya belgilangan trek raqamiga effekt qo'llaydi va bu effektning parametrini butun trek uchun ma'lum bir qiymatga sozlaydi. setEffect() bilan foydalanish mumkin bo'lgan barcha effektlar haqida batafsil ma'lumot olish uchun o'quv dasturidagi Har Bir Effektning Batafsil Tavsifi ga qarang.

track.description: Effektni joylashtirish uchun trek (yoki uni barcha treklarga qo'llash uchun MIX_TRACK)

type.description: Variantlar: BANDPASS, XOR, KOMPRESSOR, DELAY, DISTORTION, EQ3BAND, FILTER, FLANGER, PAN, PASER, PITCHHIFT, REVERB, RINGMOD, TREMOLO, VOLUME yoki WAH

parameter.description: Constant indicating which parameter of the effectType to create the envelope for. (See Every Effect Explained in Detail in the curriculum sidebar for a complete list of effect parameters.)

example.python:
# Apply a delay effect
fitMedia(Y11_SNARE_1, 1, 1, 5)
setEffect(1, DELAY, DELAY_TIME, 145)

setEffect2.description: Bu funktsiya belgilangan trek raqamiga effekt qo'llaydi. setEffect() ning boshqa versiyasidan farqli o'laroq, vaqt o'tishi bilan effekt parametrining qiymatini o'zgartiradigan zarfni sozlash uchun qo'shimcha argumentlar mavjud. setEffect() bilan foydalanish mumkin boÊ»lgan barcha effektlar haqida batafsil maÊ¼lumot olish uchun oÊ»quv dasturiga qarang: Har Bir Effektning Batafsil Tavsifi

startValue.description: Effekt zarfining boshidagi effekt parametrining qiymati

endValue.description: Effekt zarfining oxiridagi effekt parametrining qiymati

example.python:
# Increase the filter frequency over time
fitMedia(HOUSE_BREAK_FILL_001, 1, 1, 3)
setEffect(1, FILTER, FILTER_FREQ, 600, 1, 6000, 3)

tempo.description: Loyiha tempi daqiqada zarba miqdori (DZM). Minimal temp - 45 DZM. Maksimal temp - 220 DZM.

example.python:
# Set the tempo to 110 BPM
setTempo(110)
example.javascript:
// Set the tempo to 110 BPM
setTempo(110);

setTempo2.description: Loyihaning bir qismi uchun tempni o'zgartirish.

startTempo.description: Bo'lim boshidagi temp, daqiqada zarba miqdori (DZM)

endTempo.description: Bo'lim oxiridagi temp (agar o'tkazib yuborilgan bo'lsa, yangi temp keyingi temp punktiga qadar saqlanib qoladi)

example.python:
# Set the tempo to 110 BPM at measure 2
setTempo(110, 2)
# Ramp tempo from 80 to 140 BPM from measures 3 to 6
setTempo(80, 3, 140, 6)

shuffleList.description: RoÊ»yxat/massivdagi elementlarni tasodifiy qayta tartibga solish.

returns.description: RoÊ»yxat elementlarining tartibi tasodifiy boÊ»lgan yangi roÊ»yxat/massiv.

example.python:
# Shuffle a list of sounds
sounds = [OS_CLAP04, OS_COWBELL03, OS_LOWTOM02]
shuffled = shuffleList(sounds)

shuffleString.description: Satrdagi belgilarni tasodifiy qayta tartibga solish.

returns.description: Belgilar tartibi tasodifiy bo'lgan yangi satr.

example.python:
# Shuffle a beat string
beat = "0-0-0-0-0-0-0-0-"
shuffled = shuffleString(beat)

errors.AttributeError: There is a mismatch between the object and the attribute
errors.ImportError: The appropriate packages cannot be found or imported
errors.IndentationError: There is an indentation error in the code (lack or extra spaces)
errors.IndexError: There is an error using an out of range index
errors.KeyError: There is an error using a dictionary key that does not exist
errors.NameError: There is an error with a variable or function name that is not defined
errors.ParseError: There is an error when reading the code
errors.SyntaxError: There is an error with the syntax (or arrangement) of code
errors.TypeError: There is an error with the expected data type
errors.TokenError: There is an unexpected token error (extra or missing comma, space, or character) in the code
errors.ValueError: A provided argument is not within the set or range of acceptable values for a function
errors.RangeError: A provided argument is not within the set or range of acceptable values for a function
errors.ReferenceError: There is an error with a variable or function name that is not defined
errors.NetworkError: Please try running the code again. If the issue persists, check your internet connection or contact network administrator.
errors.ServerError: Please try running the code again. If the issue persists, please report the issue using 'Report Error' in the information menu.
